p: Bioactive plant oil extracted from fruit pulp always contains not only Î²-sitosterol but also vitamin E [ 16, 27]. The primary role of vitamin E in plants is to provide antioxidant activity [ 16]. It is well known that the production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) during skin injuries inhibits the healing process by various biological mechanisms [ 14, 36]. The topical use of vitamin E is to attenuate oxidative stress by inhibiting the production of oxidase and NO.
